intro: Gutierrezia, commonly known as  brittle bladderpod, is a genus of flowering plants in the sunflower family, Asteraceae. It is native to the western United States and parts of Mexico, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plants typically have hairy, branching stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer. Gutierrezia species are often found in disturbed soils and are adapted to drought conditions. They play a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various insects and small animals.
